TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProcessModelInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains methods that return information about worker processes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ProcessModelInfo class is not meant to be instantiated in your own code. Use the static <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A> methods to populate <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> objects, and then use the properties of the <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> objects to obtain information about the processes.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A> methods can be used only with Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) version 5.0 on Microsoft Windows 2000 and Windows XP or with IIS 6.0 on Windows Server 2003 and using IIS 5.0 isolation mode. For more information, see [NIB: How to: Configure ASP.NET Applications for an ASP.NET Version](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/3e2037d2-61aa-44f3-b84e-d4dab3572ad3).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> method to display statistics about the currently executing ASP.NET process on a Web page. This example will work with Internet Information Services 5.0 on Windows 2000 and Windows XP or with IIS 6.0 on Windows Server 2003 and using IIS 5.0 isolation mode.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ProcessModelInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.processmode_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ProcessModelInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.processmode_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Web.ProcessInfo GetCurrentProcessInfo() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns information about the worker process that is executing the current request.
Docs.returns: A that contains information about the current process.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetCurrentProcessInfo method is applicable only for applications that are running under the ASP.NET process model.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the GetCurrentProcessInfo method to display statistics about the currently executing ASP.NET process on a Web page.
[!code-vb[System.Web.ProcessModelInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.processmode_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.ProcessModelInfo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.processmode_1.aspx)]

Docs.exception: Process information is not available for the current request.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Web.ProcessInfo[] GetHistory(int32 numRecords) cil managed

Docs.param: The number of processes for which information is requested.
Docs.summary: Returns information about recent worker processes.
Docs.returns: An array of the most recent objects (up to 100); otherwise, if the number of available objects is less than , all available objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetHistory method is applicable only for applications that are running under the ASP.NET process model.
